intro: Mesembryanthemum amabile, commonly known as the sweet mesem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically produces yellow or orange flowers that bloom in the morning and close by midday. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure. Mesembryanthemum amabile is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
